availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jesse J. Hunt (Fayette County, Kentucky, merchant and clerk. )

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, merchant and clerk. Maryland native. Married to Mary C. Rozzelle Hunt. Father of Julia C. Hunt, M.L. Hunt, C.R. Hunt, J.G. Hunt, Rozzelle Hunt, and Nannie L. Hunt. Merchant in Frederick County, Maryland, in 1850. Merchant in Fayette County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Fayette County in 1860. Clerk in Fayette County in 1863. Served in the 5th Ohio Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a private from April 19, 1861 to July, 1861. Served in the 11th Ohio Independent Battery (U.S.A.) as a sergeant from August 24, 1861 to December 10, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Maryland, Frederick County, Frederickstown, p. 43B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, p. 532.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, p. 431A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington/Ward 1, p. 165A.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, p. 413B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Ohio, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M552, Roll 0053.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Fayette County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 9.
Historical Register of National Homes for Disabled Volunteer Soldiers, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series M1749, Roll 28, p. 1429.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #0732.
